comment.author: 15705594@N00
comment._content: This building was originally part of Murphy's Hotel (old 8th Street State Office Building). It was connected to the original hotel building by a pedestrian bridge - you can see the scar on the left along 8th Street. The bridge was cast iron and was taken down during WWII for scrap metal. The building lasted into the 1990;s before it was torn down - towards the end, there were tress growing out of the roof.
